basics.name: Jiarui Ji
basics.summary: Currently a second-year M.E. student at the Gaoling School of Artificial Intelligence

location.address: Renmin University of China, No. 59 Zhongguancun Street

education.area: B.E. in Data Science and Big Data Technology

publications.name: Leveraging LLM-based agents for social science research: insights from citation network simulations
publications.authors: Jiarui Ji, Runlin Lei, Jialing Bi, Zhewei Wei, Xu Chen, Yankai Lin, Xuchen Pan, Yaliang Li, Bolin Ding
publications.publisher: Accepted by Humanities and Social Sciences Communications (HSSCOMMS)
publications.summary: This paper presents an LLM-agent-based platform for simulating citation network dynamics, which enables controlled experimentation in academic environments.

publications.name: LLM-Based Multi-Agent Systems are Scalable Graph Generative Models
publications.authors: Jiarui Ji, Runlin Lei, Jialing Bi, Zhewei Wei, Xu Chen, Yankai Lin, Xuchen Pan, Yaliang Li, Bolin Ding
publications.publisher: The 63rd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL Findings)
publications.summary: This paper explores LLM-based multi-agent systems as scalable graph generative models.

publications.name: SRAP-Agent: Simulating and Optimizing Scarce Resource Allocation Policy with LLM-Based Agent
publications.authors: Jiarui Ji, Yang Li, Hongtao Liu, Zhicheng Du, Zhewei Wei, Qi Qi, Weiran Shen, Yankai Lin
publications.publisher: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP Findings)
publications.summary: This paper presents SRAP-Agent, a framework for simulating and optimizing scarce resource allocation policies using LLM-based agents.
